outputs.output_descr:
Conserve Threatened Savanna Woodlands
The long-term solution proposed by this project is to strengthen the national system of protected areas in Uganda by improving the management effectiveness of protected areas in the Kidepo Critical Landscape in the North Eastern part of the Country, thus affording biodiversity sufficient protection from emerging future threats. The project responds to GEF Biodiversity Focal Area, Strategic Objective One: Improve sustainability of Protected Area Systems. The project will directly bring 416,485 ha of land under strengthened PA management arrangements designed to conserve biodiversity, involving 3 different forms of PA Status (National Park, Central Forest Reserves and Community Wildlife Areas) as well as public lands and influencing additional 239,215 Ha of dispersal areas. Project has 2 components namely:- 1. Strengthening Management Effectiveness of the Kidepo Critical Landscape PA Cluster and 2. Integrating PA Management in the wider Landscape.

project_descr: Conservation and sustainable use of the threatened savanah woodland in the critical landscape of North eastern Uganda
